sentence: Good morning, and welcome to day two of the Federal Reserve System Conference on Monetary Policy Strategy, Tools, and Communication Practices.1 I think you will have to agree that the presentations and discussion yesterday were uniformly thoughtful, substantive, and stimulating, and today we will have another impressive lineup of speakers and panelists addressing timely topics that are relevant to our review.
reason: This sentence is irrelevant to US monetary policy as it merely sets the context for the Federal Reserve System Conference on Monetary Policy Strategy, Tools, and Communication Practices. It does not provide any indication of a hawkish, dovish, or neutral stance on monetary policy.

sentence: And let me convey on behalf of Chair Powell, the Board of Governors, and the Reserve Bank Presidents, a sincere and deep appreciation to all the participants on this program, especially the authors of the seven outstanding papers, for the time, thought, and energy that went into preparing their contributions.Yesterday Professors Eberly, Stock, and Wright provided us with a thorough and thoughtful evaluation of the Federal Reserve's monetary policy strategy, tools, and communications since 2009.
reason: This sentence is irrelevant to US monetary policy as it expresses gratitude towards participants and authors of papers, without providing any indication of the stance or implications of the evaluation conducted by Professors Eberly, Stock, and Wright.

sentence: They conclude that the policy tools that the Federal Open Market Committee (FOMC) relied onâ"level policy" and "slope policy," to use their terminologyâhelped restore the U.S. economy to health and bring it close to the statutory goals of maximum employment and price stability assigned to us by the Congress.As was noted several times yesterday, in recent years forecasters and policymakers have been surprised by the decline in the unemployment rate and the size of the sustained ongoing gains in payroll employment.
reason: This sentence suggests that the policy tools used by the FOMC, referred to as "level policy" and "slope policy," have been effective in improving the US economy and achieving the goals of maximum employment and price stability. It implies a neutral stance on US monetary policy as it acknowledges the positive outcomes without indicating a preference for further tightening or easing measures.

sentence: FOMC participants' estimates of the longer-run normal rate of unemployment in the Summary of Economic Projections illustrate this pointâthey have drifted lower over time as labor market conditions have improved and inflation has remained quiescent.2 The paper by Professors Abraham and Haltiwanger provided us with an innovative search-and-matching model to estimate labor market slackâwhich complements the standard estimates based on unemployment gaps and Phillips curve relationships.
reason: This sentence suggests that FOMC participants' estimates of the longer-run normal rate of unemployment have decreased over time due to improved labor market conditions and low inflation. It is relevant to US monetary policy as it indicates a dovish stance, as the lower estimates imply less slack in the labor market and potentially less need for accommodative monetary policy.

sentence: On that same general topic, the panel discussion of national and community leaders moderated by Governor Brainard provided a valuable perspective on the labor market that could not otherwise be gleaned from the aggregate statistics we often consult.Of course, notwithstanding what is taught in many U.S. macroeconomics courses, the United States is not a closed economy but is one of many nations engaged in global finance and economic commerce.
reason: This sentence is irrelevant to US monetary policy. It discusses the United States' position in the global economy and the value of a panel discussion on the labor market. It does not provide any indication of a hawkish, dovish, or neutral stance on monetary policy.

sentence: Professor Obstfeld's paper examined the ways that global economic integration affects inflation and the neutral rate of interestâor r*âand the role played by the U.S. dollar in transmitting the Federal Reserve's monetary policy to other countries.In our final session yesterday, Professors Cecchetti and Schoenholtz assessed the Federal Reserve's communication practices.
reason: This sentence is irrelevant to US monetary policy as it discusses the examination of global economic integration, inflation, and the role of the US dollar in transmitting monetary policy. It does not provide any indication of a hawkish, dovish, or neutral stance on US monetary policy.

sentence: Based on interviews and conversations with market participants, academics, and former policymakers, Professors Cecchetti and Schoenholtz offered concrete suggestions for improving our most important communications vehicles.Our program today will feature papers by Lars Svensson on alternative monetary policy strategies, by Eric Sims and Cynthia Wu on the policy toolkit, and by Anil Kashyap and Caspar Siegert on the interplay between financial stability considerations and monetary policy.
reason: This sentence is irrelevant to US monetary policy as it discusses suggestions for improving communication vehicles and features papers on alternative monetary policy strategies, the policy toolkit, and the interplay between financial stability considerations and monetary policy.

sentence: Our featured panel of national and community leaders moderated by President Rosengren will I'm sure offer valuable perspectives about how the monetary levers we pull and push affect communities, credit availability, and small businesses.Aside from being an intellectually stimulating two days, how does this week's conference fit into the FOMC's review of its monetary policy strategy, tools, and communications?
reason: This sentence suggests that the conference, moderated by President Rosengren, will provide valuable perspectives on how monetary policy affects communities, credit availability, and small businesses. It implies a neutral stance as it focuses on understanding the impact of monetary levers without indicating a specific direction for US monetary policy.

sentence: Over the past several months, the individual Reserve Banks have been hosting a series of Fed Listens eventsâseven so far including this conferenceâwith at least five more to follow in coming months.
reason: This sentence is irrelevant to US monetary policy as it discusses the organization of Fed Listens events, which does not directly indicate a hawkish, dovish, or neutral stance. These events aim to gather public input and may not have immediate implications on monetary policy decisions.

sentence: In Dallas, we heard from local leaders about the challenges facing lower-income communities.
reason: This sentence is irrelevant to US monetary policy as it discusses challenges facing lower-income communities in Dallas. It does not provide any indication of a hawkish, dovish, or neutral stance on monetary policy.

sentence: In Minneapolis, we listened to researchers discuss the distributional consequences of the economic cycle and of monetary policy.

sentence: In Boston, we heard from small businesses, labor leaders, and groups that work in underserved communities about the effects of the Fed's policymaking on New England residents.

reason: This sentence is irrelevant to US monetary policy as it discusses the perspectives of panelists on the importance of the Fed's dual mandate goals, without indicating any specific stance or implications on monetary policy.

sentence: As I and my Fed colleagues who have participated in these events will attest, they have provided us with valuable perspectives on the economy that we would not otherwise be able to glean from aggregate economic statistics.In coming regularly scheduled meetings, the FOMC will undertake its assessment of our monetary policy strategy, tools, and communication practices.
reason: This sentence is irrelevant to US monetary policy. It discusses the value of perspectives gained from events and the future assessment of monetary policy strategy, tools, and communication practices, but it does not provide any indication of whether the policy will be hawkish, dovish, or neutral.

sentence: This assessment will be informed by what we've heard at this conference, by our listening sessions in the Federal Reserve Districts, and by the work of System staff.
reason: This sentence suggests that the assessment of US monetary policy will be influenced by the information gathered from the conference, listening sessions, and the work of System staff. It implies a neutral stance as it does not explicitly indicate a hawkish or dovish bias.

sentence: When the Committee tackles important issues, we take the time for wide-ranging and candid discussions, and so I expect our deliberations will continue over several meetings for the remainder of this year.
reason: This sentence suggests a neutral stance on US monetary policy. The mention of wide-ranging and candid discussions indicates a cautious approach, which aligns with a neutral stance. The expectation of continued deliberations over several meetings implies a patient and gradual approach, rather than a hawkish or dovish one.

sentence: The views expressed are my own and not necessarily those of other Federal Reserve Board members or Federal Open Market Committee participants.
reason: This sentence is irrelevant to US monetary policy as it simply states that the views expressed are personal and may not align with other members of the Federal Reserve Board or the Federal Open Market Committee.

sentence: In January 2009, when longer-run projections were added to the Summary of Economic Projections, the midpoint of the central tendency for the longer-run normal unemployment rate was 4.9 percent.
